game

Class BoardManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.BoardManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BoardManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represent the board of a game and every action that can be done to the pawns on this board
    Author:
    Q.Cosnier
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public Types[][] getBoard()
        Return the array of Types that represent the board. Each position of the array that contain null represent an empty square
        Returns:
        the two dimensional array of Types

      • getSolutions

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getSolutions(int posX,
                                               int posY)
        Used to calculate the solutions that a pawn have at a precise position and with a certain type of pawn
        Parameters:
        posX - the x position where to search the solutions
        posY - the y position where to search the solutions
        Returns:
        an two dimensional array of int that represent every solutions by is x and y component.

      • movePawn

        public boolean movePawn(int posX1,
                        int posY1,
                        int posX2,
                        int posY2)
        Move a pawn at a specified location to another
        Parameters:
        posX1 - the x pos where to take the pawn to move
        posY1 - the y location where to take the pawn to move
        posX2 - the x location where to place the taken pawn
        posY2 - the y location where to place the taken pawn
        Returns:
        true if moving the pawn destroyed another one, false if not.

      • gameEnded

        public boolean gameEnded(Types player)
        Check if the specified player have won
        Parameters:
        player - the player to test
        Returns:
        true if the actual player have won,false if not

      • getLastZenPos

        public int[] getLastZenPos()
        Return the last position of the zen pawn
        Returns:
        a two dimensional int array that represent the last position of the zen pawn

      • setLastZenPos

        public void setLastZenPos(int posX,
                          int posY)
        Set the last zen location
        Parameters:
        posX - the x position of the zen
        posY - the y position of the zen

      • getMyPawns

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getMyPawns(Types side)
        Return a list of all the pawns position for a given side
        Parameters:
        side - the side to search the pawn
        Returns:
        an array of int that contains the location of every pawn
